name: DSE ICT - Programming Assessment
subject: ICT
instructions: This rubric is used to assess programming questions in HKDSE ICT. Evaluate across three dimensions: Program Logic, Code Quality, and Output Correctness.

levels.descriptor: Algorithm is correct and efficient. Logic is clear and well-structured. Handles all cases including edge cases. Control structures used appropriately.
Algorithm is mostly correct. Logic is clear. May miss some edge cases. Good use of control structures.
Algorithm has minor logical errors. Basic structure is correct. Some cases not handled properly.
Algorithm has significant logical errors. Structure is unclear. Many cases not handled.
Algorithm is fundamentally flawed or missing. Little understanding of problem requirements.
Code is well-organized with meaningful variable names. Proper indentation and formatting. Good use of comments where needed. No syntax errors.
Code is organized with reasonable variable names. Mostly proper formatting. Minor syntax issues.
Code is somewhat organized. Variable names could be improved. Some formatting issues. Few syntax errors.
Code is disorganized. Poor variable names. Many formatting issues. Several syntax errors.
Code is very disorganized or largely incomplete. Major syntax errors that prevent execution.
Output is completely correct for all test cases. Format matches requirements exactly.
Output is correct for most test cases. Minor formatting differences.
Output is partially correct. Some test cases fail.
Output is mostly incorrect. Few test cases pass.
No correct output or program does not run.
